Description: Rim sherd of Attic pottery Cassel cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: black band around rim above frieze of alternating red and black tongues; three lines below; in handle zone frieze of ivy leaves.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 42, pl. XXI, no. 23)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 424, no. B669)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1360) (phase 3)
